      • setAspectRatio

        public void setAspectRatio(float ratio)
        Adjusts one of the viewport's sizes to match the given aspect ratio.

        Note that the new size will be rounded up to the nearest integer. If you need more accurate results use setSize(int, int).
        Also: Setting the aspect ratio does not change the viewport orientation.
        Parameters:
        ratio - A value >= 1.0.

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(int orientation)
        Adjusts the viewport to the given orientation by flipping around the sizes if necessary.
        Parameters:
        orientation -

      • centerBy

        public void centerBy(int maxWidth,
                     int maxHeight)
        Centers the viewport to the rectangle (0, 0 -- maxHeight, maxWidth), but retains the original offsets (which will be added to the new bounds).
        Parameters:
        maxWidth -
        maxHeight -

      • clampscale

        Parameters:

        maxHeight -

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation()
        Description copied from interface: IScreenViewport
        Returns the current orientation or this viewport.
        Specified by:
        getOrientation in interface IScreenViewport
        Returns:
        IScreenViewport.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT if height > width, IScreenViewport.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE if height < width, or IScreenViewport.ORIENTATION_NONE if height == width.
